past.title: Microservices Community 1st General Assembly, Online Event
past.longtext:
• Description: The Microservices Community will host its 1st General Assembly, which holds the highest authority and where all members of the MC have the right to participate and vote. The agenda will include the introduction to the Community Group Structure, reports from the Community Groups (Communication, Ethics, Education, Industrial Applications) , and a final round table with introductions and indications of interest.
  • Registration: Sign up by sending an e-mail to MC Board Member Christian Walther Bruun from Grøn/Bruun no later than March 22nd, 2021, 12:00 CET.

past.title: Ballerina: OS cloud-native programming language
past.longtext:
• Description: In this joint event with Imola Informatica, you will learn about Ballerina, a cloud-native programming language. Developers spend more time integrating cloud-native technologies to their programming language, compared to the core business logic. Ballerina offers language integrated features, such as network awareness through a built-in services concept, communication resilience, observability, and deployment technology awareness, such as Kubernetes. It's an open source project, Apache 2 licensed.
  • Registration: The event is free of charge and open to everyone. Please follow this link to sign up for the event.

past.title: Online Seminar: Microservices-Based Architectures for Next-Gen Industrial Applications
past.longtext:
• Description: In this joint event with CRIT, members of the Microservices Community will learn about
    • Edge Microservices and Industrial IoT for Digital Manufacturing
    • Serverless Architecture vs Microservice Architecture
    • Next-Generation Programming Languages: Jolie and Ballerina
  • Registration: Members of the Microservices Community can sign up for the seminar by sending an e-mail to MC Council member Claudio Guidi.

past.title: Online seminar on R&I funding for Microservices in Horizon Europe
past.longtext:
• Description: Microservice Community members and non-members will get insight into the opportunities of obtaining EU funding via the upcoming framework programme Horizon Europe. The funding supports research and innovation activities for companies, universities and organisations interested in developing joint European projects.
  • Cost: Free of charge.
  • Registration: Sign up by sending an e-mail to MC Board Member Christian Walther Bruun from Grøn/Bruun no later than December 10th, 2020, 12:00.
